episode_summary: This episode covers a range of fascinating topics including the use of ping pong balls by firefighters to control wildfires, the logistics of performing an ultrasound on a large python, the rarity and naming of the gemstone Hidenite, and the world record for crushing watermelons with thighs.

facts.fact: Firefighters use ping pong balls to put out wildfires.
It takes eight people to do an ultrasound on a python.
One of the hardest gemstones to find is called Hidenite, but that is not why it's called that.
The world record for crushing watermelons with your thighs is three in 7.5 seconds.
